title: ME60111: Internal Combustion Engine - Quick Facts
text:
ME60111
Course name | Internal Combustion Engine
Offered by | Mechanical Engineering
Credits | 4
L-T-P | 3-1-0

1
EX | A | B | C | D | P | F
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Air standard and fuel–air cycle analysis of Otto, Diesel and limited pressure cycles. Effect of design and operating parameters on cycle efficiency. Modified fuel-air cycle considering heat losses and valve timing. Engine dynamics and torque analysis. Fuels and combustion in S.I. engines, knocking and fuel rating. Energy balance, volumetric efficiency, measurement of indicated and brake power. Advanced theory of carburetion. Cooling of engine and governing of engine. Ignition system: conventional and electronic. Supercharging. Variable compression ratio engine. Wankel rotary combustion engine. Exhaust emissions, its measurement and control. Fault diagnosis of S.I. Engines. Modelling of I.C. Engine Combustion.
